results.content: Useful knowledge. I need to look this course again because author explains and types the code simultaneously so I didn't catch 90% of what he talks about. But despite of these issues the course was interesting.

results.content:
Pretty good at showing the Rust and JS integration with WASM but no explanation for most things really .
Considering there are not much examples on the internet about this for an actual development scenario this is as good as it gets.
results.content_html:

results.content:
I'm unfortunately leaving a rather negative rating, but I hope to do it constructively.

My main issues with this course are:

- this is not a course in a strict sense; it's an exposition of the steps performed in order to write and build the game; there is little teaching
- following it is also relatively difficult; one needs to frequently pause, and even worse, sometimes, the Visual Studio Code popups cover the underlying code
- the author is not experienced neither in Rust, nor in game development: as a rust programmer, I recognize unidiomatic Rust constructs
- overall, the logic for the program is unnecessarily complex (the snake game logic can be implemented using very simple concepts; no need for linear algebra); the input is buggy on my browser, and I suspect that this is due to the JS implementation not being solid as well

All in all, if one wants to observe how to wire a WASM application, and the steps taken to implement it, this course does it.

But there's little value over just observing the repository history, and also, subpar code quality is a big factor.

I can hardly give constructive advice, because I'm familiar with technical writing, and I know that writing a solid course takes enormously more resources than just writing the code and wiring it.

Summarizing, I think 2.5 stars are a reasonable rating.

results.content: Finally a course that is more than just a "42" Hello World RustWasm Example!
results.content_html: Finally a course that is more than just a "42" Hello World RustWasm Example!

results.content: If you prefer to follow courses by typing the code, this is going to frustrate you. There is no pause between a line in a function being completed, and the tutor scrolling to the next section or moving to another file. The pace is very fast, core concepts are no explained in much detail. The aspects of the course that are useful is seeing how the Rust and WASM ecosystem fits together, which is not represented in enough detail. If you want to develop browser based games, this is an excellent course, but if you want to understand the fundamentals of Rust and WASM as a platform for web app development, I wouldn't recommend the course.

results.content: Wish instructor spent more time explaining the key utilities, e.g. what exactly is wasm-pack doing, best practices, e.g. maybe we shouldn't be cloning Vector every single time but rather showing us how to access wasm's linear memory
